intro: Tetrapterys skutchii, commonly known as the Guatemalan thornapple, is a flowering plant native to Central America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive, palmate leaves with four lobes. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in inflorescences. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds, and it is often found in dry, open habitats. Tetrapterys skutchii is not widely cultivated but is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological role.
